message_1: A researcher conducts a survey on the daily number of hours spent on different activities by 100 students. The researcher wants to reduce the data by compressing the information into a few variables. The researcher performs principal component analysis and obtains two principal components. The two principal components explain 70% and 20% of the total variation, respectively. Calculate the percentage of the total variation explained by the remaining principal components.
message_2:
To calculate the percentage of the total variation explained by the remaining principal components, we need to subtract the percentages explained by the first two principal components from 100%.

Total variation = 100%
Total variation explained by the first two principal components = 70% + 20% = 90%

Percentage of total variation explained by the remaining principal components = Total variation - Total variation explained by the first two principal components

Percentage of total variation explained by the remaining principal components = 100% - 90% = 10%

So, the remaining principal components explain 10% of the total variation.
